Question.Subject: Why is my firefox doing this.?
Question.Content:
I use mozilla firefox, and the other day i opened up a new browser and i got this "Unable to connect Firefox can't establish a connection to the server at www.ask.com * The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.
* If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer's network connection.
* If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Firefox is permitted to access the web"
And i even deleted the file and redownloaded it and it still says that.
Anyone know what i can do to fix it?
Oh and the ask.com is what pops up whenever i open a new browser. I just did what you told me to do and i still get what i've been getting.
Question.ChosenAnswer: You either 1) need to adjust your firewall options in firefox and your firewall or 2) You're having computer network problems

Answer.Content: You either 1) need to adjust your firewall options in firefox and your firewall or 2) You're having computer network problems

your network settings have been compromised.
Try: Tools - Options - Advanced - Network - Connection - Settings
If you are the usual internet user, it should be set to "no proxy"
Any other setting should be reset to "no proxy".
If you use a server (unlikely), then the network points to the server for internet access.
